Package multiplayer

Class GameClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • multiplayer.GameClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientProtocol
    public class GameClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientProtocol
    This class represents the communication with the server. It sends and receives messages with/from the server. It also handles the incoming messages with the methods that are overriden from the ClientProtocol. The message handler methods use the TUI to show the user what has happened in the game and also communicates with the players game board for game logic related matters. Mostly just creating a board and updating the board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameClient()
      Initialises the TUI and a new game board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameClient

        public GameClient()
        Initialises the TUI and a new game board. Then calls setup().

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Prompts the user about their player name and whether they want to play multiplayer or singleplayer. If player chooses to play multiplayer then an enemy board is created, new move thread is created, and a connection to the server is created that is followed by handshake and calling start() to listen to server messages. If player chooses to play single player then a new instance of a game is created and the game handles all singleplayer matters there.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - If IO error occurs when communicating with the server.
        ProtocolException - If there is a messup with a protocol message.
        java.io.IOException - If a general IO error occurs not related to communcation with server.

      • createConnection

        public void createConnection()
                      throws SocketCreationException
        Creates a connection to the server. Requests the IP and port to connect to at the view (TUI). The method continues to ask for an IP and port and attempts to connect until a connection is established or until the user indicates to exit the program.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException
        SocketCreationException

      • clearConnection

        public void clearConnection()
        Resets the serverSocket and In- and OutputStreams to null. Always make sure to close current connections via closeConnection() before calling this method!

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the connection by closing the In- and OutputStreams, as well as the socket.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
                 throws ServerUnavailableException
        Sends a message to the connected server followed by a new line. The stream is then flushed.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send to the server.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occurs.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws ServerUnavailableException,
                  ProtocolException
        Continuously listens to server input and forwards the input to the handleCommand(String) method.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO error occurs.
        ProtocolException - if there is a messup with a protocol message.

      • handleCommand

        public void handleCommand​(java.lang.String input)
                   throws ServerUnavailableException,
                          ProtocolException
        Deals with the messages received from the server. If the input is a valid protocol message it calls the respective methods to deal with the message.
        Parameters:
        input - The message from the server that is checked whether it's a valid protocol message.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO error occurs.
        ProtocolException - if there is a messup with a protocol message.

      • handleHello

        public void handleHello​(java.lang.String playerName)
                 throws ServerUnavailableException
        Sends a handshake message by the protocol to the server given a player's name.
        Specified by:
        handleHello in interface ClientProtocol
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - If there's an IO problem with the server.

      • nameExists

        public void nameExists()
                throws ServerUnavailableException
        Prompts the user for a new player name if the one sent initially is taken by the opponent. When user enter the new player name, it calls ClientProtocol.handleHello(String) with the new player name.
        Specified by:
        nameExists in interface ClientProtocol
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - If there's an IO problem with the server.

      • enemyName

        public void enemyName​(java.lang.String enemyName)
               throws ServerUnavailableException
        After server sends the opponents name, this method displays it and prints the user's board and the enemy's board. Then sends the user's board to the server.
        Specified by:
        enemyName in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        enemyName - the name of the opponent
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - If there's an IO problem with the server.

      • clientBoard

        public void clientBoard​(gameboards.GameBoard board)
                 throws ServerUnavailableException
        Given an instance of a game board, it send the encoded version of the board to the server.
        Specified by:
        clientBoard in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        board - The board instance to be encoded and sent to the server.
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - If there's an IO problem with the server.

      • gameSetup

        public void gameSetup​(java.lang.String whoGoesFirstName)
        Receives from the server information about which player makes the first move. Starts the move thread that continuously asks for coordinates of a move. Then if it's the user's move it prints a message informing the user of that and sets the myMove variable to true.
        Specified by:
        gameSetup in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        whoGoesFirstName - The name of the player that goes first.

      • move

        public void move​(int x,
                 int y)
          throws ServerUnavailableException
        Called by the move thread to send the move to the server if it is the user's move. If it isn't the user's move, it informs the user of that and doesn't send the move to server.
        Specified by:
        move in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the move.
        y - The y value of the move
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - If there's an IO problem with the server.

      • update

        public void update​(int x,
                   int y,
                   boolean isHit,
                   boolean isSunk,
                   boolean isLate,
                   java.lang.String whoWentName,
                   java.lang.String whoGoesNextName)
        The method handles updates received from the server after one of the players have made a move. The three main things the method does based on what the update indicates is informs of the changes that occured such as whether it's user's move, whether previous move resulted in a hit/sunk ship, updates and prints out the user's board and the user's enemies board. And finally, it switches the myMove variable based on whos move it is supposed to be next.
        Specified by:
        update in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        x - the x value of the previous move
        y - the y value of the previous move
        isHit - indicates whether previous move was a hit on a ship
        isSunk - indicates whether previous move sunk a whole ship
        isLate - Indicates whether the previous move was performed late
        whoWentName - Name of the player that made the move
        whoGoesNextName - Name of the player that's supposed to go next

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver​(java.lang.String winnerName,
                     boolean winType)
        Method that is called when game ends. This could happen if 5 minutes pass, someone sinks all of opponent's ships or one of the clients disconnects. The method informs user of why the game ended and of its result.
        Specified by:
        gameOver in interface ClientProtocol
        Parameters:
        winnerName - The name of the winner or empty string if it's a tie.
        winType - True if the game ended normally, false if game ended because one of the players quit.

      • sendExit

        public void sendExit()
              throws ServerUnavailableException
        Sends a message to the server indicating that this client will exit.
        Specified by:
        sendExit in interface ClientProtocol
        Throws:
        ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occur.
